characteristics_ch1: strain: B6.129-AhR^tm1Bra/J,genotype: AhR -/-,tissue: retinal pigment epithelium (RPE)-choroid,age: 11-13 months
data_processing: Basecalling and quality scoring on Cassava 1.8.2,Alignment to mouse mm10 genome using Bowtie with settings tophat -p 4 --keep-tmp mm10UCSC *input_file*.fastq; where "mm10USCS" points to Bowtie genome index files,HTseq  summary of counts across genes, python -m HTSeq.scripts.count -s no -m intersection-strict <path to .sam file> <path to genome annotation .gtf file> > <path to output file>,EdgeR - caclulation of differential expression using HTSeq counts merged.txt as input, removing all genes that have less than 1 count in 2 or more sample, and using ExactTest to define differntial expression.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: HTseq_counts_merged.txt contains read counts per gene produced by HTseq, where each data column corresponds to a sample. EdgeR genes prefiltered.txt contains output from EdgeR,  and includes fold change between AhR KO and WT, average CPM across all samples, and metrics of statistical testing of differential expression per gene. Both .txt files are flat tab delimited files.
extract_protocol_ch1: Eyes were enucleated, anterior segment and retina removed, RPE/choroid was isolated in Trizol and RNA extracted with Qiagen Rneasy mini kit with DNase1 digestion,RPE-choroid from two eyes was pooled and libraries prepared with the Illumina TruSeq kit with polyA enrichment
title: AhR knockout

characteristics_ch1: genotype/variation: Dicer KO,cell type: murine mesenchymal stem cells
data_processing: Reads were aligned to the mm9 genome using Bowtie2,BAM-files were filtered for repetitive regions,HT_Seq-Count was used to count reads within exons or introns,DESeq v1.10.1 was used to quantify reads between conditions,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: DESeq v1.10.1 output is included for all RefSeq transcripts including normalized read counts for the combined replicates, fold change and p-value representing significance of differential expression between WT and KO
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA from both untreated fibroblasts as well as transfected fibroblasts was also isolated from subconfluent WT and KO fibroblasts using QIAzol (phenol/chloroform) extraction and RNA was DNase-treated to avoid any gDNA contamination. Illumina TruSeq,The manufacturerâs recommendations were followed to obtain strand-specific libraries which were then then submitted to single-end sequencing on an Illumina HiSeq 2000.
title: Dicer KO Fibroblasts [RiboZero-prepped library]

characteristics_ch1: cell line: IDG-SW3,time point: Day 28,agent: Control,sample id: Cont_D28_A,index: ATCACG
contact_institute: U. of Texas Health Sci Center at San Antonio
data_processing: Initial analysis was with Illumina RTA 1.13.48 software. Base calling was carried out with the Casava 1.8. 2 software package and the resulting fastq files were further analyzed with  NGS software programs in our Unix based Alamo Cluster at UTHSCSA with over 350 nodes.,The fastq files were loaded into U. of Texas Health Science Ctr at SanAntonio Alamo Supercomputer with preload NGS software and our Python Scripts. We used the TopHat-2 and Bowtie-2 for sequence alignments to the mouse mm9 genome,The resulting .bam files were further analyzed using Cufflink-2, CuffCompare, and differential expression between Cont and PTH was determined using CuffDiff-2 program,The accepted_hits .bam files from TopHat-2 analysis were also  converted  to bedgraph files (bamtools), and then to bigWig files (bedGraphToBigWig tools) for loading into UCSC Browser or other genomic  browsers.,The 3 control  or 3 PTH accepted_hits.bam files were also merged with merge function in SamTools, then converted to bedgraph and bigWig files for overall analysis and presentation of effect of PTH using the UCSC or other genome browsers.,Also, included in the processed data analysis is the CuffDiff data with p and q values for differentially expressed genes between Cont and PTH treated samples, with an n=3.,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Each of the 6 .xls files (3 Cont and 3 PTH) contain the gene_id, transcription start site symbol for the gene, the chromosome location and position, and the fpkm with confidence level. Also included are the the 6 bigWig files for loading into UCSC or other genomic Browser. The merged Cont and PTH data as bigwig files is also included where the 3 Cont or 3 PTH bam files were sorted, index, and merged, converted to bedgraph and then bigWig  (bw) files.
extract_protocol_ch1: The total RNA was harvested in TRI-Zol reagent (1ml per well). RNA was extracted using phenol/chloroform as per the manufacturer's instructions.,The Illumina TruSeq_RNA-Seq_v2 library construction kit was used as per instructions using 2-3 ug of Total RNA as starting material after DNase1 digestion.
source_name_ch1: IDG-SW3 Cell Line derived from long bones of Dmp1-GFP positive/temperature sensitive T-antigen positive  mice (Woo et al, 2011, J. BoneMin.Res 26:2634-2646)
title: IDG-SW3 Control  rep1

characteristics_ch1: background strain: C57BL/6 x 129,cell line: KH2,cell type: mouse embryonic stem cells (ESCs),genotype/variation: iErk1; Erk KO
data_processing: By base calling, the original image data produced by the sequencer is transferred into sequences, which are defined as "raw reads" (or "raw data") and saved as ".fastq" files. As the raw reads may contain low quality reads and or adaptor sequences, preprocessing is necessary before starting further analysis. Normally, data cleaning (or data filtering) is performed to obtain "clean reads" (or "clean data") for further analysis.,As there are some adaptor sequences and/or low quality reads present in the raw reads, data filtering is carried out to obtain high quality reads as the clean reads (clean data). The procedure include following steps:1. Remove reads with adaptor sequences.  2. Remove reads in which the percentage of unknown bases (N) is greater than 10%.  3. Remove low quality reads. If the percentage of the low quality base (base with quality value â¤ 5) is greater than 50% in a read, we define this read as low quality.,Clean reads are the high quality sequences after data cleaning, on which all following analyses are based.,Clean reads were mapped to reference sequences and/or reference gene set using SOAPaligner/SOAP2[1]. No more than 2 mismatches were allowed in the alignment.,The expression level for each gene is determined by the numbers of reads uniquely mapped to the specific gene and the total number of uniquely mapped reads in the sample(see 3.2.7.2 for details). The related information of gene is also provided (Coverage, Symbol, Description and so on).,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Text files include RPKM values for each Sample
extract_protocol_ch1: Trizol and Qiagen RNeasy kit,The total RNA samples are first treated with DNase I to degrade any possible DNA contamination. Then the mRNA is enriched by using the oligo(dT) magnetic beads (for eukaryotes). Mixed with the fragmentation buffer, the mRNA is fragmented into short fragments (about 200 bp). Then the first strand of cDNA is synthesized by using random hexamer-primer. Buffer, dNTPs, RNase H and DNA polymerase I are added to synthesize the second strand. The double strand cDNA is purified with magnetic beads. End reparation and 3'-end single nucleotide A (adenine) addition is then performed. Finally, sequencing adaptors are ligated to the fragments. The fragments are enriched by PCR amplification. During the QC step, Agilent 2100 Bioanaylzer and ABI StepOnePlus Real-Time PCR System are used to qualify and quantify of the sample library. The library products were sequenced via Illumina HiSeqTM 2000 (SE50).
source_name_ch1: iErk1; Erk KO ESCs cultured without Dox for 96 hours, and treated with PD0325901 in the last 48 hours
title: P2_PD

characteristics_ch1: strain: C57/B6 and 129 mix,tissue: liver,age: postnatal day 90,genotype: Arid1a Fl/Fl
data_processing: Sequence reads were aligned to mouse  genome version mm9(pre-phx) and mm10(post-phx) using TopHat.,The number of reads aligned to RefSeq annotated genes' exons were counted and further normalized to be of unit RPKM (number of reads per kilo base pair per million total reads),Differential gene expression analyses were performed using edgeR.,Genome_build: mm9 and mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: text file of gene RPKM values
extract_protocol_ch1: Frozen liver tissues RNA was harvested using Trizol reagent and the Qiagen miRNeasy Mini kit.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina or Nugen library protocols.

contact_address: One Baylor Plaza, Mail Stop: BCM305
data_processing: Illumina bcl2fastq 1.8.3 software used for basecalling and FASTQ file generation.,Sequenced reads in FASTQ files were mapped to mm10 whole genome using Tophat (Galaxy tool version 0.9) with parameters -r 100. UCSC known transcripts were supplied in GTF format file.,Fragments Per Kilobase of transcript per Million mapped reads (FPKM) were calculated using Cufflinks (Galaxy tool version 2.2.1.0) with parameters -r 100. UCSC known transcripts were supplied in GTF format file.,Genome_build: GRCm38 (mm10),Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *txt: Tab-delimited text files include UCSC transcript id and their FPKM values, along with confidence intervals for each sample.
extract_protocol_ch1: NucleoSpin RNA Kit from Macherey-Nagel, using manufacturer's protocol.,Total RNA samples were made into cDNA using the NuGEN OvationÂ® RNA-Seq System V2 kit (using both random priming and poly d(T) priming). cDNA from the NuGEN kit were taken into the Illumina TruSeq DNA Sample Prep Kit for library construction. Completed libraries were sequenced on the Illumina HiSeq 2500.
source_name_ch1: mouse prostate luminal cells, AR KO
title: 2232-Luminal-ARKO#1

characteristics_ch1: genotype/variation: LncCPR-KO,time point: day 0
data_processing: RNA-Seq reads were aligned to the mouse genome using tophat (6) with parameters: -p 8 --read-mismatches 2 --b2-L 20 -g 5. Reads, which mapped to multiple locations of the genome, were discarded before downstream analysis. An annotated list of known transcripts (mm9 UCSC refseq genes) was used for final set of transcriptome. The abundance and number of raw fragments aligned to each gene were computed using cufflinks. The abundance of each gene was expressed as FPKM (Fragments Per Kilobase of transcript per Million mapped reads).,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: fpkm txt file - gene expression
extract_protocol_ch1: total RNA was isolated from undifferentiated and whole embryoid bodies at day 3, 5, 8, 10, or 12 post-hang drop by using the RNeasy kit from Qiagen (Qiagen N.V., Venlo, Netherlands).,For the time-series transcriptome profiling, a total of 1 Î¼g of total RNA from AB2.2 and AB2.2-LncCPR-/- cells was used for generating next-generation sequencing libraries with Illuminaâs HiSeq3000 platform. data_processing: RNA-Seq reads were aligned to the mouse genome using tophat (6) with parameters: -p 8 --read-mismatches 2 --b2-L 20 -g 5. characteristics_ch1: strain/genotype: 499 STAT1 KO,treatment: None,cell type: CD45 negative tumor cells
data_processing: Basecalls performed using Illumina CASAVA software.,Raw reads were trimmed for adaptor sequence using cutadapt v1.9 (parameter -q 10 -m 30 -O 4),Trimmed reads were mapped to consensus rRNA sequences using bowtie2 v2.2.4 to remove rRNA reads (parameter --fr --no-mixed --no-discordant),Reads were then aligned with STAR v2.4.0k to GRCm38/mm10 reference genome (parameter --outFilterMultimapNmax 100 --outFilterMismatchNmax 999 --outFilterMismatchNoverLmax 0.06),Non primary alignment and QC failed reads were removed with samtools (parameter -F 772),Aligned and filtered reads were counted against GENCODE annotation vM4 using Subread v1.4.6 (parameter -s 2 -minReadOverlap 10),Genome_build: GRCm38/mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab delimited txt file including raw read count for each gene feature.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated and purified from the cells using Isol-RNA Lysis Reagent (Fisher) and treated with DNase I (Fisher).,RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the TrueSeq Stranded Total RNA Library Prep Kit (Illumina)
title: RNA_499_STAT1_KO_1

characteristics_ch1: strain/genotype: 499 STAT1 KO,treatment: None,cell type: CD45 negative tumor cells
data_processing: Basecalls performed using Illumina CASAVA software.,Raw reads were trimmed for adaptor sequence using cutadapt v1.9 (parameter -q 10 -m 30 -O 4),Trimmed reads were mapped to consensus rRNA sequences using bowtie2 v2.2.4 to remove rRNA reads (parameter --fr --no-mixed --no-discordant),Reads were then aligned with STAR v2.4.0k to GRCm38/mm10 reference genome (parameter --outFilterMultimapNmax 100 --outFilterMismatchNmax 999 --outFilterMismatchNoverLmax 0.06),Non primary alignment and QC failed reads were removed with samtools (parameter -F 772),Aligned and filtered reads were counted against GENCODE annotation vM4 using Subread v1.4.6 (parameter -s 2 -minReadOverlap 10),Genome_build: GRCm38/mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab delimited txt file including raw read count for each gene feature.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated and purified from the cells using Isol-RNA Lysis Reagent (Fisher) and treated with DNase I (Fisher).,RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the TrueSeq Stranded Total RNA Library Prep Kit (Illumina)
title: RNA_499_STAT1_KO_3

characteristics_ch1: strain: C57/B6,tissue: Bone marrow derived Macrophages,gender: Male,age: 8 Weeks
contact_institute: University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences
data_processing: Illumina Casava software used for basecalling.,To prepare the reads for alignment, the sequencing adapters and other low quality bases were clipped(1).  Reads were aligned to External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) sequences to assess the success of library construction and sequencing.,A subset of the reads (~1 million reads) were aligned to other spiked-in control sequences (PhiX and other Illumina controls used during library preparation), residual sequences (globin and ribosomal RNA), and poly-A/T sequences that persisted after clipping.  The reads were also aligned to a sampling of intergenic regions to assess the level of DNA contamination level.,To quantify transcripts, RSEM v1.2.0 was used to quantify genes and transcripts (2) using the UCSC knownGene transcriptome.  Reads that remained unaligned to the transcriptome may be due to miss annotation, lack of annotation, or from genomic DNA.  To determine the origin of all reads as a method of quality control, the unaligned reads were aligned to the full genome (not transcriptome) using BWA 0.6.23 (3).          References   1.  Erik Aronesty (2013). TOBioiJ : "Comparison of Sequencing Utility Programs", 2. Li and Dewey BMC Bioinformatics 2011, 12:323.  3.  Li and Durbin Bioinformatics 2009 [PMID: 19451168].,Genome_build: mm10
extract_protocol_ch1: Bone marrow-derived macrophages, in vitro differentiation to the M1 type and Total RNA was extracted using 5 PRIME PerfectPureâ¢ Purification System (5prime). TruSeq Stranded mRNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, #RS-122-2103) was used with 100ng of total RNA for the construction of sequencing libraries,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols
title: Mac Trpc3 knocout-1

Reads were aligned to External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) sequences to assess the success of library construction and sequencing.,A subset of the reads (~1 million reads) were aligned to other spiked-in control sequences (PhiX and other Illumina controls used during library preparation), residual sequences (globin and ribosomal RNA), and poly-A/T sequences that persisted after clipping.  The reads were also aligned to a sampling of intergenic regions to assess the level of DNA contamination level.,To quantify transcripts, RSEM v1.2.0 was used to quantify genes and transcripts (2) using the UCSC knownGene transcriptome.  Reads that remained unaligned to the transcriptome may be due to miss annotation, lack of annotation, or from genomic DNA.  To determine the origin of all reads as a method of quality control, the unaligned reads were aligned to the full genome (not transcriptome) using BWA 0.6.23 (3).          References   1.  Erik Aronesty (2013). TOBioiJ : "Comparison of Sequencing Utility Programs", 2. Li and Dewey BMC Bioinformatics 2011, 12:323.  3.  Li and Durbin Bioinformatics 2009 [PMID: 19451168].,Genome_build: mm10
extract_protocol_ch1: Bone marrow-derived macrophages, in vitro differentiation to the M1 type and Total RNA was extracted using 5 PRIME PerfectPureâ¢ Purification System (5prime). TruSeq Stranded mRNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, #RS-122-2103) was used with 100ng of total RNA for the construction of sequencing libraries,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols
title: Mac Trpc3 knocout-3

characteristics_ch1: background strain: E14,cell type: ESC,genotype: Dicer KO
data_processing: RNASeq: Raw FastQ data were trimmed with Trim Galore (v0.3.5, default parameters) and mapped to the mouse NCBIM37 genome assembly using TopHat v2.0.11, guided by gene models from Ensembl v61. Data were quantitated at mRNA level using the RNA-seq quantitation pipeline in SeqMonk software (www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/seqmonk/) applying transcript length correction.,Genome_build: NCBIM37,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Quantitated RNA-Seq data file is tab delimited and contains the following 41 columns: (1) gene name; (2) Chromosome; (3) Start; (4) End; (5) Strand; (6-41) RPKM values for each sample
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated using TriReagent (Sigma) and treated with DNAseI (Ambion DNA-free DNA Cat #1311027) using manufacturers instructions,Total RNA libraries (ribozero) were made using 200ng-1Î¼g RNA at the Sanger Institute Illumina bespoke pipeline

data_processing: Basecalls performed using CASAVA version 1.7,Subsequent to demultiplexing and adapter trimming, fastqs were mapped to mm10 with splice-aware aligner STAR vers-2.3.0 using mm10 Ensembl gtf,To calculate RPKM expression values, sequencing reads were counted over an assembly of all putative exons for each gene and normalized by the length of the exon assembly and by the size of the library.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Gene counts for each sample are given in tab-delimited txt files.

data_processing: Basecalls performed using Illumina CASAVA software.,Raw reads were trimmed for adaptor sequence using cutadapt v1.9 (parameter -q 10 -m 30 -O 4),Trimmed reads were mapped to consensus rRNA sequences using bowtie2 v2.2.4 to remove rRNA reads (parameter --fr --no-mixed --no-discordant),Reads were then aligned with STAR v2.4.0k to GRCm38/mm10 reference genome (parameter --outFilterMultimapNmax 100 --outFilterMismatchNmax 999 --outFilterMismatchNoverLmax 0.06),Non primary alignment and QC failed reads were removed with samtools (parameter -F 772),Aligned and filtered reads were counted against GENCODE annotation vM4 using Subread v1.4.6 (parameter -s 2 -minReadOverlap 10),Genome_build: GRCm38/mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab delimited txt file including raw read count for each gene feature.

characteristics_ch1: strain: mic-IFNAR-KO,organ: brain,selection marker: CD11b+ CD45int,treatment: AAV-IFNb
data_processing: Illumina bcl2fastq software used for basecalling.,Sample barcodes were extracted from read 2 and concatenated to the fastq header of read 1. Barcode is of size 7 followed by UMI of size 8,alignment: hisat 0.1.5  with deafult parameters,filter PCR amplification bias using alignment break site and UMI barcode (size 8).,create tag directory using makeTagDirectory from HOMER tools (http://homer.salk.edu/homer/ngs/),HOMER, quantifying RNA expression in genes: analyzeRepeats.pl rna mm9 -d <List of tag dir> -count 3utr -condenseGenes -strand + -norm 1e7,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include mRNA molecule count values for each Sample
extract_protocol_ch1: 10^4-10^5 cells from each macrophage subpopulation were sorted in 100-200 ul of Lysis/Binding Buffer (Life technologies), lysed for 5 min and frozen at -80Â°C. Cell lysates were thawed and mRNA was captured with 12 ul of Dynabeads oligo(dT) (Life technologies), and washed according to manufacture guidelines. Purified messenger RNA was eluted at 70Â°C with 10 ul of 10 mM Tris-Cl pH 7.5 and stored at -80Â°C,cDNA was generated from 1ul of mRNA of each sample. cDNA quantity in each sample was evaluated by qPCR for Actin B gene, and then equivalent amounts of mRNA of each sample were taken for RNAseq library construction. Library construction was performed in a 96-well plate format. First, to open secondary RNA structures and allow annealing of the RT primer, the samples were incubated at 72ËC for 3 min and immediately transferred to 4ËC. Then, RT reaction mix (10 mM DTT, 4 mM dNTP, 2.5 U/Âµl Superscript III RT enzyme in 50 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.3), 75 mM KCl, 3 mM MgCl2) was added into each well of the 96-well plate and the reaction was mixed. The 96-well plate was then spun down and moved into a cycler (Eppendorf) for the following incubation: 2 min at 42ËC, 50 min at 50ËC, 5 min at 85ËC. Indexed samples with equivalent amount of cDNA were pooled.Â  The pooled cDNA was converted to double-stranded DNA with a second strand synthesis kit (NEB) in a 20Âµl reaction, incubating for 2.5 h at 16ËC. The product was purified with 1.4x volumes of SPRI beads, eluted in 8 Âµl and in-vitro transcribed (with the beads) at 37ËC overnight for linear amplification using the T7 High Yield RNA polymerase IVT kit (NEB). Following IVT, the DNA template was removed with Turbo DNase I (Ambion) 15 min at 37ËC and the amplified RNA (aRNA) purified with 1.2x volumes of SPRI beads. Library preparation for high-throughput sequencing: The aRNA was chemically fragmented into short molecules (median size ~200 nucleotides) by incubating 3 min at 70ËC in Zn2+ RNA fragmentation solution (Ambion) and purified with two volumes of SPRI beads. The aRNA (5 Âµl) was preincubated 3 min at 70ËC with 1 Âµl of 100 ÂµM ligation adapter; then, 14 Âµl of a mix containing 9.5% DMSO, 1 mM ATP, 20% PEG8000 and 1 U/Âµl T4 ligase in 50 mM Tris HCl pH7.5, 10 mM MgCl2 and 1mM DTT was added. The reaction was incubated at 22ËC for 2 h. The ligated product was reverse transcribed using Affinity Script RT enzyme (Agilent; reaction mix contains Affinity Script RT buffer, 10 mM DTT, 4 mM dNTP, 2.5 U/Âµl RT enzyme) and a primer complementary to the ligated adapter. The reaction was incubated for 2 min at 42ËC, 45 min at 50ËC and 5 min at 85ËC.Â  The cDNA was purified with 1.5x volumes of SPRI beads. The library was completed and amplified through a nested PCR reaction with 0.5 ÂµM of P5_Rd1 and P7_Rd2 primers and PCR ready mix (Kapa Biosystems). The forward primer contains the Illumina P5-Read1 sequences and the reverse primer contains the P7-Read2 sequences. The amplified pooled library was purified with 0.7x volumes of SPRI beads to remove primer leftovers. Library concentration was measured with a Qubit fluorometer (Life Technologies) and mean molecule size was determined with a 2200 TapeStation instrument (Agilent). MARS-Seq libraries were sequenced using an Illumina HiSeq 1500.,3' RNA-seq for digital gene expression quantitation

Then, RT reaction mix (10 mM DTT, 4 mM dNTP, 2.5 U/Âµl Superscript III RT enzyme in 50 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.3), 75 mM KCl, 3 mM MgCl2) was added into each well of the 96-well plate and the reaction was mixed. The 96-well plate was then spun down and moved into a cycler (Eppendorf) for the following incubation: 2 min at 42ËC, 50 min at 50ËC, 5 min at 85ËC. Indexed samples with equivalent amount of cDNA were pooled.Â  The pooled cDNA was converted to double-stranded DNA with a second strand synthesis kit (NEB) in a 20Âµl reaction, incubating for 2.5 h at 16ËC. The product was purified with 1.4x volumes of SPRI beads, eluted in 8 Âµl and in-vitro transcribed (with the beads) at 37ËC overnight for linear amplification using the T7 High Yield RNA polymerase IVT kit (NEB). Following IVT, the DNA template was removed with Turbo DNase I (Ambion) 15 min at 37ËC and the amplified RNA (aRNA) purified with 1.2x volumes of SPRI beads. Library preparation for high-throughput sequencing: The aRNA was chemically fragmented into short molecules (median size ~200 nucleotides) by incubating 3 min at 70ËC in Zn2+ RNA fragmentation solution (Ambion) and purified with two volumes of SPRI beads. The aRNA (5 Âµl) was preincubated 3 min at 70ËC with 1 Âµl of 100 ÂµM ligation adapter; then, 14 Âµl of a mix containing 9.5% DMSO, 1 mM ATP, 20% PEG8000 and 1 U/Âµl T4 ligase in 50 mM Tris HCl pH7.5, 10 mM MgCl2 and 1mM DTT was added. The reaction was incubated at 22ËC for 2 h. The ligated product was reverse transcribed using Affinity Script RT enzyme (Agilent; reaction mix contains Affinity Script RT buffer, 10 mM DTT, 4 mM dNTP, 2.5 U/Âµl RT enzyme) and a primer complementary to the ligated adapter. The reaction was incubated for 2 min at 42ËC, 45 min at 50ËC and 5 min at 85ËC.Â  The cDNA was purified with 1.5x volumes of SPRI beads. The library was completed and amplified through a nested PCR reaction with 0.5 ÂµM of P5_Rd1 and P7_Rd2 primers and PCR ready mix (Kapa Biosystems). The forward primer contains the Illumina P5-Read1 sequences and the reverse primer contains the P7-Read2 sequences. The amplified pooled library was purified with 0.7x volumes of SPRI beads to remove primer leftovers. Library concentration was measured with a Qubit fluorometer (Life Technologies) and mean molecule size was determined with a 2200 TapeStation instrument (Agilent). MARS-Seq libraries were sequenced using an Illumina HiSeq 1500.,3' RNA-seq for digital gene expression quantitation

Barcode is of size 7 followed by UMI of size 8,alignment: hisat 0.1.5  with deafult parameters,filter PCR amplification bias using alignment break site and UMI barcode (size 8).,create tag directory using makeTagDirectory from HOMER tools (http://homer.salk.edu/homer/ngs/),HOMER, quantifying RNA expression in genes: analyzeRepeats.pl rna mm9 -d <List of tag dir> -count 3utr -condenseGenes -strand + -norm 1e7,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include mRNA molecule count values for each Sample
extract_protocol_ch1: 10^4-10^5 cells from each macrophage subpopulation were sorted in 100-200 ul of Lysis/Binding Buffer (Life technologies), lysed for 5 min and frozen at -80Â°C. Cell lysates were thawed and mRNA was captured with 12 ul of Dynabeads oligo(dT) (Life technologies), and washed according to manufacture guidelines. Purified messenger RNA was eluted at 70Â°C with 10 ul of 10 mM Tris-Cl pH 7.5 and stored at -80Â°C,cDNA was generated from 1ul of mRNA of each sample. cDNA quantity in each sample was evaluated by qPCR for Actin B gene, and then equivalent amounts of mRNA of each sample were taken for RNAseq library construction. Library construction was performed in a 96-well plate format. First, to open secondary RNA structures and allow annealing of the RT primer, the samples were incubated at 72ËC for 3 min and immediately transferred to 4ËC. Then, RT reaction mix (10 mM DTT, 4 mM dNTP, 2.5 U/Âµl Superscript III RT enzyme in 50 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.3), 75 mM KCl, 3 mM MgCl2) was added into each well of the 96-well plate and the reaction was mixed. The 96-well plate was then spun down and moved into a cycler (Eppendorf) for the following incubation: 2 min at 42ËC, 50 min at 50ËC, 5 min at 85ËC. Indexed samples with equivalent amount of cDNA were pooled.Â  The pooled cDNA was converted to double-stranded DNA with a second strand synthesis kit (NEB) in a 20Âµl reaction, incubating for 2.5 h at 16ËC. The product was purified with 1.4x volumes of SPRI beads, eluted in 8 Âµl and in-vitro transcribed (with the beads) at 37ËC overnight for linear amplification using the T7 High Yield RNA polymerase IVT kit (NEB). Following IVT, the DNA template was removed with Turbo DNase I (Ambion) 15 min at 37ËC and the amplified RNA (aRNA) purified with 1.2x volumes of SPRI beads. Library preparation for high-throughput sequencing: The aRNA was chemically fragmented into short molecules (median size ~200 nucleotides) by incubating 3 min at 70ËC in Zn2+ RNA fragmentation solution (Ambion) and purified with two volumes of SPRI beads. The aRNA (5 Âµl) was preincubated 3 min at 70ËC with 1 Âµl of 100 ÂµM ligation adapter; then, 14 Âµl of a mix containing 9.5% DMSO, 1 mM ATP, 20% PEG8000 and 1 U/Âµl T4 ligase in 50 mM Tris HCl pH7.5, 10 mM MgCl2 and 1mM DTT was added. The reaction was incubated at 22ËC for 2 h. The ligated product was reverse transcribed using Affinity Script RT enzyme (Agilent; reaction mix contains Affinity Script RT buffer, 10 mM DTT, 4 mM dNTP, 2.5 U/Âµl RT enzyme) and a primer complementary to the ligated adapter. The reaction was incubated for 2 min at 42ËC, 45 min at 50ËC and 5 min at 85ËC.Â  The cDNA was purified with 1.5x volumes of SPRI beads. The library was completed and amplified through a nested PCR reaction with 0.5 ÂµM of P5_Rd1 and P7_Rd2 primers and PCR ready mix (Kapa Biosystems). The forward primer contains the Illumina P5-Read1 sequences and the reverse primer contains the P7-Read2 sequences. The amplified pooled library was purified with 0.7x volumes of SPRI beads to remove primer leftovers. Library concentration was measured with a Qubit fluorometer (Life Technologies) and mean molecule size was determined with a 2200 TapeStation instrument (Agilent). MARS-Seq libraries were sequenced using an Illumina HiSeq 1500.,3' RNA-seq for digital gene expression quantitation

characteristics_ch1: cell type: ES cell,treatment: DEX,time point: 24 hours,sample type: MoFlo sorted cell,starting amount: single cell,cell cycle phase: All phase,method subtype: RamDA-seq
contact_institute: National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST)
data_processing: FASTQ files were generated using bcl2fastq (v2.16.0.10).,For RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq data with living cells, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used for adapter trimming with the parameters '-l 36 --lowcomplex-pct 74 --homopolymer- pct 74 -k 4' for RamDA-seq and '-L 75 -l 46 -k 4 -q 30' for C1-RamDA-seq. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 -X 800 --sp 1000,1000'. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command with the parameters '-isMapped true -tag NH:1' and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). The transcript-level expression levels were quantified using sailfish (version 0.9.2). The transcript-level expression levels were also calculated using Bowtie2 (version 2.2.6) with the parameters '-k 100 -X 800' and eXpress (version 1.5.1) with the parameter '--no-bias-correct'.,For each scRNA-seq method data with 10 pg of diluted RNA, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used to trim adapter sequences and generate read lengths of 42 nt with the parameters â-L 42 -l 42 -k 4 -q 30 -Sâ. For comparison, we also prepared R1 reads of rdRNA-seq and paRNA-seq data. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 (version 2.0.1) with parameters â--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 --sp 1000,1000â. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools (version 2.0.1;) 53 âfilterâ command with the parameters `-isMapped true -tag NH:1` and the samtools (version 2.0.1)54 âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). Sailfish (version 0.9.2) was used to quantify transcript-level expressions.,For bulk poly(A) and total RNA-seq data, fastq-mcf was used to trim adapter sequences with the parameters â-l 50 --lowcomplex-pct 36 --homopolymer-pct 36 -k 4 -Sâ. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For ribosomal RNA depleted total RNA-seq, depletion of rRNA from 1 Âµg of ES total RNA was performed by using GeneRead rRNA Depletion Kits (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").

data_processing: FASTQ files were generated using bcl2fastq (v2.16.0.10).,For RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq data with living cells, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used for adapter trimming with the parameters '-l 36 --lowcomplex-pct 74 --homopolymer- pct 74 -k 4' for RamDA-seq and '-L 75 -l 46 -k 4 -q 30' for C1-RamDA-seq. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 -X 800 --sp 1000,1000'. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command with the parameters '-isMapped true -tag NH:1' and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). The transcript-level expression levels were quantified using sailfish (version 0.9.2). The transcript-level expression levels were also calculated using Bowtie2 (version 2.2.6) with the parameters '-k 100 -X 800' and eXpress (version 1.5.1) with the parameter '--no-bias-correct'.,For each scRNA-seq method data with 10 pg of diluted RNA, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used to trim adapter sequences and generate read lengths of 42 nt with the parameters â-L 42 -l 42 -k 4 -q 30 -Sâ. For comparison, we also prepared R1 reads of rdRNA-seq and paRNA-seq data. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 (version 2.0.1) with parameters â--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 --sp 1000,1000â. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools (version 2.0.1;) 53 âfilterâ command with the parameters `-isMapped true -tag NH:1` and the samtools (version 2.0.1)54 âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For ribosomal RNA depleted total RNA-seq, depletion of rRNA from 1 Âµg of ES total RNA was performed by using GeneRead rRNA Depletion Kits (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").

Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools (version 2.0.1;) 53 âfilterâ command with the parameters `-isMapped true -tag NH:1` and the samtools (version 2.0.1)54 âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). Sailfish (version 0.9.2) was used to quantify transcript-level expressions.,For bulk poly(A) and total RNA-seq data, fastq-mcf was used to trim adapter sequences with the parameters â-l 50 --lowcomplex-pct 36 --homopolymer-pct 36 -k 4 -Sâ. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For ribosomal RNA depleted total RNA-seq, depletion of rRNA from 1 Âµg of ES total RNA was performed by using GeneRead rRNA Depletion Kits (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").

The transcript-level expression levels were also calculated using Bowtie2 (version 2.2.6) with the parameters '-k 100 -X 800' and eXpress (version 1.5.1) with the parameter '--no-bias-correct'.,For each scRNA-seq method data with 10 pg of diluted RNA, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used to trim adapter sequences and generate read lengths of 42 nt with the parameters â-L 42 -l 42 -k 4 -q 30 -Sâ. For comparison, we also prepared R1 reads of rdRNA-seq and paRNA-seq data. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 (version 2.0.1) with parameters â--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 --sp 1000,1000â. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools (version 2.0.1;) 53 âfilterâ command with the parameters `-isMapped true -tag NH:1` and the samtools (version 2.0.1)54 âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). Sailfish (version 0.9.2) was used to quantify transcript-level expressions.,For bulk poly(A) and total RNA-seq data, fastq-mcf was used to trim adapter sequences with the parameters â-l 50 --lowcomplex-pct 36 --homopolymer-pct 36 -k 4 -Sâ. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For ribosomal RNA depleted total RNA-seq, depletion of rRNA from 1 Âµg of ES total RNA was performed by using GeneRead rRNA Depletion Kits (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").

data_processing: FASTQ files were generated using bcl2fastq (v2.16.0.10).,For RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq data with living cells, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used for adapter trimming with the parameters '-l 36 --lowcomplex-pct 74 --homopolymer- pct 74 -k 4' for RamDA-seq and '-L 75 -l 46 -k 4 -q 30' for C1-RamDA-seq. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 -X 800 --sp 1000,1000'. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command with the parameters '-isMapped true -tag NH:1' and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). The transcript-level expression levels were quantified using sailfish (version 0.9.2). The transcript-level expression levels were also calculated using Bowtie2 (version 2.2.6) with the parameters '-k 100 -X 800' and eXpress (version 1.5.1) with the parameter '--no-bias-correct'.,For each scRNA-seq method data with 10 pg of diluted RNA, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used to trim adapter sequences and generate read lengths of 42 nt with the parameters â-L 42 -l 42 -k 4 -q 30 -Sâ. For comparison, we also prepared R1 reads of rdRNA-seq and paRNA-seq data. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 (version 2.0.1) with parameters â--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 --sp 1000,1000â. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools (version 2.0.1;) 53 âfilterâ command with the parameters `-isMapped true -tag NH:1` and the samtools (version 2.0.1)54 âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). Sailfish (version 0.9.2) was used to quantify transcript-level expressions.,For bulk poly(A) and total RNA-seq data, fastq-mcf was used to trim adapter sequences with the parameters â-l 50 --lowcomplex-pct 36 --homopolymer-pct 36 -k 4 -Sâ. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For ribosomal RNA depleted total RNA-seq, depletion of rRNA from 1 Âµg of ES total RNA was performed by using GeneRead rRNA Depletion Kits (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").

C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").
title: RamDA_mESC_24h_C04

characteristics_ch1: cell type: ES cell,treatment: DEX,time point: 24 hours,sample type: MoFlo sorted cell,starting amount: single cell,cell cycle phase: All phase,method subtype: RamDA-seq
contact_institute: National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST)
data_processing: FASTQ files were generated using bcl2fastq (v2.16.0.10).,For RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq data with living cells, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used for adapter trimming with the parameters '-l 36 --lowcomplex-pct 74 --homopolymer- pct 74 -k 4' for RamDA-seq and '-L 75 -l 46 -k 4 -q 30' for C1-RamDA-seq. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 -X 800 --sp 1000,1000'. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command with the parameters '-isMapped true -tag NH:1' and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). The transcript-level expression levels were quantified using sailfish (version 0.9.2). The transcript-level expression levels were also calculated using Bowtie2 (version 2.2.6) with the parameters '-k 100 -X 800' and eXpress (version 1.5.1) with the parameter '--no-bias-correct'.,For each scRNA-seq method data with 10 pg of diluted RNA, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used to trim adapter sequences and generate read lengths of 42 nt with the parameters â-L 42 -l 42 -k 4 -q 30 -Sâ. For comparison, we also prepared R1 reads of rdRNA-seq and paRNA-seq data. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 (version 2.0.1) with parameters â--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 --sp 1000,1000â. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools (version 2.0.1;) 53 âfilterâ command with the parameters `-isMapped true -tag NH:1` and the samtools (version 2.0.1)54 âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). Sailfish (version 0.9.2) was used to quantify transcript-level expressions.,For bulk poly(A) and total RNA-seq data, fastq-mcf was used to trim adapter sequences with the parameters â-l 50 --lowcomplex-pct 36 --homopolymer-pct 36 -k 4 -Sâ. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").

The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").
title: RamDA_mESC_24h_C09

characteristics_ch1: cell type: ES cell,treatment: DEX,time point: 24 hours,sample type: MoFlo sorted cell,starting amount: single cell,cell cycle phase: All phase,method subtype: RamDA-seq
contact_institute: National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST)
data_processing: FASTQ files were generated using bcl2fastq (v2.16.0.10).,For RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq data with living cells, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used for adapter trimming with the parameters '-l 36 --lowcomplex-pct 74 --homopolymer- pct 74 -k 4' for RamDA-seq and '-L 75 -l 46 -k 4 -q 30' for C1-RamDA-seq. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 -X 800 --sp 1000,1000'. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command with the parameters '-isMapped true -tag NH:1' and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). The transcript-level expression levels were quantified using sailfish (version 0.9.2). The transcript-level expression levels were also calculated using Bowtie2 (version 2.2.6) with the parameters '-k 100 -X 800' and eXpress (version 1.5.1) with the parameter '--no-bias-correct'.,For each scRNA-seq method data with 10 pg of diluted RNA, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used to trim adapter sequences and generate read lengths of 42 nt with the parameters â-L 42 -l 42 -k 4 -q 30 -Sâ. For comparison, we also prepared R1 reads of rdRNA-seq and paRNA-seq data. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 (version 2.0.1) with parameters â--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 --sp 1000,1000â. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools (version 2.0.1;) 53 âfilterâ command with the parameters `-isMapped true -tag NH:1` and the samtools (version 2.0.1)54 âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). Sailfish (version 0.9.2) was used to quantify transcript-level expressions.,For bulk poly(A) and total RNA-seq data, fastq-mcf was used to trim adapter sequences with the parameters â-l 50 --lowcomplex-pct 36 --homopolymer-pct 36 -k 4 -Sâ. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig

These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For ribosomal RNA depleted total RNA-seq, depletion of rRNA from 1 Âµg of ES total RNA was performed by using GeneRead rRNA Depletion Kits (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").

data_processing: FASTQ files were generated using bcl2fastq (v2.16.0.10).,For RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq data with living cells, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used for adapter trimming with the parameters '-l 36 --lowcomplex-pct 74 --homopolymer- pct 74 -k 4' for RamDA-seq and '-L 75 -l 46 -k 4 -q 30' for C1-RamDA-seq. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 -X 800 --sp 1000,1000'. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command with the parameters '-isMapped true -tag NH:1' and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). The transcript-level expression levels were quantified using sailfish (version 0.9.2). The transcript-level expression levels were also calculated using Bowtie2 (version 2.2.6) with the parameters '-k 100 -X 800' and eXpress (version 1.5.1) with the parameter '--no-bias-correct'.,For each scRNA-seq method data with 10 pg of diluted RNA, fastq-mcf (version 1.04.807) was used to trim adapter sequences and generate read lengths of 42 nt with the parameters â-L 42 -l 42 -k 4 -q 30 -Sâ. For comparison, we also prepared R1 reads of rdRNA-seq and paRNA-seq data. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 (version 2.0.1) with parameters â--dta-cufflinks -p 4 -k 5 --sp 1000,1000â. Uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools (version 2.0.1;) 53 âfilterâ command with the parameters `-isMapped true -tag NH:1` and the samtools (version 2.0.1)54 âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For ribosomal RNA depleted total RNA-seq, depletion of rRNA from 1 Âµg of ES total RNA was performed by using GeneRead rRNA Depletion Kits (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").

BigWig files were generated using deepTools (version 2.2.4). Sailfish (version 0.9.2) was used to quantify transcript-level expressions.,For bulk poly(A) and total RNA-seq data, fastq-mcf was used to trim adapter sequences with the parameters â-l 50 --lowcomplex-pct 36 --homopolymer-pct 36 -k 4 -Sâ. The reads were mapped to the mouse genome (mm10) using HISAT2 with the parameters '--dta-cufflinks --rna-strandness RF -k 5 --no-mixed --no-discordant --sp 1000,1000'. Properly (i.e., convergent read pairs) and uniquely mapped reads were selected using the bamtools âfilterâ command and samtools âviewâ command with the parameter â-q 40â. For genome-guided transcriptome assembly, Cufflinks (version 2.2.1) was used with the parameters â--multi-read-correct --frag-bias-correct -M $mask --library-type fr-unstrandedâ. A GTF file of tRNA and rRNA annotations in GENCODE (vM9) were provided to mask the genome. Cuffcompare was used to annotate transcripts with transfrag class codes with respect to the GENCODE (vM9) annotation. According to the Cuffcompare class codes, we selected (1) unnannotated transcripts with class codes of "i", "o", "u", "x", or "s" and (2) unannotated splicing variant transcripts (âjâ class (potentially novel isoform)) with at least one unannotated splice junction. We then removed (1) unannotated transcripts with exons located within 100 bp of the tRNA or rRNA annotations in GECODE or RepeatMasker, or pseudogene annotations in GENCODE (â2wayconspseudosâ), and (2) unannotated transcripts with lengths that were not monger than 200 bp. These filtered unannotated gene models were further merged with gene models in GENCODE vM9.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt, gtf, bigWig
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using an RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen). For ribosomal RNA depleted total RNA-seq, depletion of rRNA from 1 Âµg of ES total RNA was performed by using GeneRead rRNA Depletion Kits (Qiagen). For single-cell RamDA-seq, single cells were directly sorted into the cell lysis buffer containing RNasein plus (Promega), Cell Lysis Buffer (Roche), NP40 (Thermo), and RNase free water (TaKaRa). For averaged G1-phase cell lysate sample, 180 cells were sorted into 180 Âµl of the cell lysis buffer and individually divided into 1 Î¼l in a 96-well PCR plate after well-mixing to lyse the cells. The cell lysate solution was stored at -80ÂºC until use.,For bulk RNA-seq, the libraries were constructed by using a commercial kit (NEBNext Ultra Directional RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina; NEB) in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol, with slight modifications during the reverse-transcription and PCR steps. SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared according to manufacturer's instructions accompanying the SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing (Clontech). For library construction of RamDA-seq and C1-RamDA-seq, refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs". For rRNA-depleted RNA-seq using 1 and 10 ng of diluted total RNA, sequencing libraries were prepared with KAPA RNA HyperPrep Kit with RiboErase (Kapa Biosystems) according to the manufacturer's protocol. C1-SMART-Seq v4 libraries were prepared using Fluidigm C1 with the script "Full-length mRNA Sequencing" was downloaded from Script Hub (https://jp.fluidigm.com/c1openapp/scripthub)in accordance with the manufacturer's protocol. For analyses of plate-to-plate variability (batch effect) of RamDA-seq, we prepared RamDA-seq library DNA by using the advanced method of RamDA-seq (refer to the protocol in "Single-cell full-length total RNA sequencing uncovers dynamics of non-polyadenylated RNAs, recursive splicing and enhancer RNAs").
