characteristics_ch1: embryo stage: E12.5,sorted population: GFP+RFP+lin-
data_processing: FASTQ files were pseudo-aligned to the mouse transcriptome (Gencode M18) using Salmon,Transcripts were collapsed into gene quantifications using tximport,Cells with < 3000 genes or genes detected in < 5 cells were discarded,We combined all single cell data sets (E12.5 , E12.5 LV, E17.5, ANNpos, ANNneg, E12.5 Myc +/-) to create a union set for identifying highly variable genes (HVG).  We utilized a statistical model (Brennecke et al 2013) incorporating ERCC spike-ins to identify biological variability from technical noise in our experiments.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Filtered (Passing the parameters above) or Unfiltered Gene counts and TPM tables
extract_protocol_ch1: Tissue was treated overnight at 4C in dispase. Epidermis was separated from dermis and dermis was discarded. Epidermis was then treated 20 min at 37C in 1:1 mix of trypsin/versene. Tissue was then homogenized and filtered to obtain a single cell suspension using 70um cell strainers. Single cell suspensions were stained with AnnexinV (Alexa Fluor 568 conjugated, Thermofisher, 1:200) and sorted into 96-well plates using a BD FACSAriaII. CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

We utilized a statistical model (Brennecke et al 2013) incorporating ERCC spike-ins to identify biological variability from technical noise in our experiments.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Filtered (Passing the parameters above) or Unfiltered Gene counts and TPM tables
extract_protocol_ch1: Tissue was treated overnight at 4C in dispase. Epidermis was separated from dermis and dermis was discarded. Epidermis was then treated 20 min at 37C in 1:1 mix of trypsin/versene. Tissue was then homogenized and filtered to obtain a single cell suspension using 70um cell strainers. Single cell suspensions were stained with AnnexinV (Alexa Fluor 568 conjugated, Thermofisher, 1:200) and sorted into 96-well plates using a BD FACSAriaII. CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

data_processing: FASTQ files were pseudo-aligned to the mouse transcriptome (Gencode M18) using Salmon,Transcripts were collapsed into gene quantifications using tximport,Cells with < 3000 genes or genes detected in < 5 cells were discarded,We combined all single cell data sets (E12.5 , E12.5 LV, E17.5, ANNpos, ANNneg, E12.5 Myc +/-) to create a union set for identifying highly variable genes (HVG).  We utilized a statistical model (Brennecke et al 2013) incorporating ERCC spike-ins to identify biological variability from technical noise in our experiments.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Filtered (Passing the parameters above) or Unfiltered Gene counts and TPM tables
extract_protocol_ch1: Tissue was treated overnight at 4C in dispase. Epidermis was separated from dermis and dermis was discarded. Epidermis was then treated 20 min at 37C in 1:1 mix of trypsin/versene. Tissue was then homogenized and filtered to obtain a single cell suspension using 70um cell strainers. Single cell suspensions were stained with AnnexinV (Alexa Fluor 568 conjugated, Thermofisher, 1:200) and sorted into 96-well plates using a BD FACSAriaII. CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

data_processing: FASTQ files were pseudo-aligned to the mouse transcriptome (Gencode M18) using Salmon,Transcripts were collapsed into gene quantifications using tximport,Cells with < 3000 genes or genes detected in < 5 cells were discarded,We combined all single cell data sets (E12.5 , E12.5 LV, E17.5, ANNpos, ANNneg, E12.5 Myc +/-) to create a union set for identifying highly variable genes (HVG).  We utilized a statistical model (Brennecke et al 2013) incorporating ERCC spike-ins to identify biological variability from technical noise in our experiments.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Filtered (Passing the parameters above) or Unfiltered Gene counts and TPM tables
extract_protocol_ch1: Tissue was treated overnight at 4C in dispase. Epidermis was separated from dermis and dermis was discarded. Epidermis was then treated 20 min at 37C in 1:1 mix of trypsin/versene. Tissue was then homogenized and filtered to obtain a single cell suspension using 70um cell strainers. Single cell suspensions were stained with AnnexinV (Alexa Fluor 568 conjugated, Thermofisher, 1:200) and sorted into 96-well plates using a BD FACSAriaII. CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

data_processing: FASTQ files were pseudo-aligned to the mouse transcriptome (Gencode M18) using Salmon,Transcripts were collapsed into gene quantifications using tximport,Cells with < 3000 genes or genes detected in < 5 cells were discarded,We combined all single cell data sets (E12.5 , E12.5 LV, E17.5, ANNpos, ANNneg, E12.5 Myc +/-) to create a union set for identifying highly variable genes (HVG).  We utilized a statistical model (Brennecke et al 2013) incorporating ERCC spike-ins to identify biological variability from technical noise in our experiments.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Filtered (Passing the parameters above) or Unfiltered Gene counts and TPM tables
extract_protocol_ch1: Tissue was treated overnight at 4C in dispase. Epidermis was separated from dermis and dermis was discarded. Epidermis was then treated 20 min at 37C in 1:1 mix of trypsin/versene. Tissue was then homogenized and filtered to obtain a single cell suspension using 70um cell strainers. Single cell suspensions were stained with AnnexinV (Alexa Fluor 568 conjugated, Thermofisher, 1:200) and sorted into 96-well plates using a BD FACSAriaII. CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

data_processing: FASTQ files were pseudo-aligned to the mouse transcriptome (Gencode M18) using Salmon,Transcripts were collapsed into gene quantifications using tximport,Cells with < 3000 genes or genes detected in < 5 cells were discarded,We combined all single cell data sets (E12.5 , E12.5 LV, E17.5, ANNpos, ANNneg, E12.5 Myc +/-) to create a union set for identifying highly variable genes (HVG).  We utilized a statistical model (Brennecke et al 2013) incorporating ERCC spike-ins to identify biological variability from technical noise in our experiments.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Filtered (Passing the parameters above) or Unfiltered Gene counts and TPM tables
extract_protocol_ch1: Tissue was treated overnight at 4C in dispase. Epidermis was separated from dermis and dermis was discarded. Epidermis was then treated 20 min at 37C in 1:1 mix of trypsin/versene. Tissue was then homogenized and filtered to obtain a single cell suspension using 70um cell strainers. Single cell suspensions were stained with AnnexinV (Alexa Fluor 568 conjugated, Thermofisher, 1:200) and sorted into 96-well plates using a BD FACSAriaII. CD45 (biotinylated rat anti CD45, BD Biolegend, 1:200), CD117 (biotinylated rat anti CD117/c-kit, Biolegend, 1:200), CD31 (biotinylated rat anti-CD31/PECAM, Bioscience, 1:200), and CD140a (biotinylated rat anti-CD140a, Biolegend, 1:200) were used as lineage negative markers (to exclude immune cells, melanoblasts, endothelium, and fibroblasts, respectively). All lin- were detected with a strepdavidin-conjugated FITC or APCCy7 secondary (Biolegend, 1:500).,Single cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared using the Smart-seq2 protocol (see reference 40) with a few modifications as follows: plates were thawed on ice and incubated for 3 min at 72C to lyse cells. Reverse transcription (4U/ml Maxima H- transcriptase), template switching reaction and PCR pre-amplification (15 cycles) were performed according to the manufacturersâ protocol. PCR products were cleaned up using 0.8X AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter). The cDNA library quality was assessed by qPCR for primer pairs targeting the housekeeping gene, Gapdh. Samples showing high Ct value (>35 cycles) or having no PCR amplification were excluded from downstream analysis. 50-100pg of each cDNA library was used for generating Illumina sequencing libraries using a Nextera XT DNA library preparation kit (Illumina). After the final PCR amplification step, samples were pooled and cleaned by 0.9X AMPure XP beads. The pooled sequencing libraries were sequenced in the RU genomics facility on an Illumina Nextseq500 instrument using the High Output 75 PE kit.

characteristics_ch1: strain background: C57BL/6,genotype/variation: Lnc GMR KO,stimulation: VSV 9h,cell typ: bone marrow-derived macrophage (BMDM)
data_processing: Sequencing raw reads were preprocessed by filtering out rRNA reads, sequencing adapters, short-fragment reads and other low-quality reads using fastp (version 0.17.1),HISAT2 (version 2.1.0)  was used to map the cleaned reads to the mouse GRCm38.p4 (mm10) reference genome.,After genome mapping, StringTie (version v1.3.4d ) was run with a reference annotation to generate FPKM values ï¼Fragments Per Kilobase of exon model per Million mapped readsï¼for known gene models.,Differentially expressed genes were identified using DESeq2 (version 1.18.1) with R (version 3.4.3) . The p-value significance threshold in multiple tests was set by the false discovery rate (FDR).,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: FPKM
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen, Germany). Total RNA was quantified using Bioanalyzer 4200 (Agilent, santa Clara, CA, USA), and RNA integrity was determined using an Agilent 2100 system and an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, CA, USA).,The next-generation libraries were prepared using VAHTS mRNA-Seq v2 Library Prep Kit for IlluminaÂ® (Vazyme). The Library quality was determined by Bioanalyzer 4200 (Agilent).Then the RNA-Seqlibraries was sequenced in HiSeq X10 system (Illumina) on a 150bp paired-end run.
title: Lnc GMR KO

characteristics_ch1: strain background: C57BL/6,genotype/variation: MyoDCre+;LoxP-/-,age: 10 weeks,tissue: Skeletal Muscle
data_processing: RNA quantity and quality was assessed using a NanoDrop UV spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc), and a Bioanalyser (Agilent Technology Inc).,The 4 RNA-seq libraries were sequenced on the Illumina NextSeq 500 platform. The reads were trimmed for sequencing adapters.,Trimmed reads were aligned to the reference mouse genome version mm10 (GRCm38) using Tophat version 2.0.10.,Gene quantification was performed on the mapped sequences using the htseq-count software version 0.6.1,Differential expression was analyzed using DESeq2 package, log transformation was used to normalize raw read counts and to calculate normalized expression counts.,Genome_build: mm10 (GRCm38),Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Excel files include Log2FoldChange, Log10pvalue, IfcMLE, IfcSE and padj values for each group (Control/muHuR-KO)
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA from muscle samples was isolated using TRIzo reagent (Invitrogen) according to the manufacturer instructions.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols
title: muHuR-KO-1.9

data_processing: Illumina Casava software used for basecalling.,Sequenced reads were trimmed for adaptor sequence.,Reads mapped to mm10 whole genome by Tophat with default options,Fragment Per Kilobase of exon per Megabase of library size (FPKM) were calculated using Cufflinks with default options. extract_protocol_ch1: HSC cells from poly(I:C)-treated WT control and mTOR KO mice were sorted by FACS. RNA were extracted using miRNeasy Micro Kit (Qiagen, 217084).,RNA-seq libraries were prepared using Illumina TruSeq Stranded Total RNA Sample Preparation Kit (Illumina, 20020597)

characteristics_ch1: strain background: C57BL/6,genotype/variation: Dnm2 +/K562E,age: 2 months,tissue: Soleus muscle
data_processing: The raw reads were first cleaned by removing adapter sequences, trimming low quality ends, and filtering reads with low quality (phred quality <20) using Trimmomatic (Version 0.33).,The read alignment was done with STAR (v2.5.1b). As reference we used the Ensembl genome build GRCm38.p5 with the gene annotations downloaded on 2015-06-25 from Ensembl (release 80.),The STAR alignment options were "--outFilterType BySJout --outFilterMatchNmin 30 --outFilterMismatchNmax 10 --outFilterMismatchNoverLmax 0.05 --alignSJDBoverhangMin 1 --alignSJoverhangMin 8 --alignIntronMax 1000000 --alignMatesGapMax 1000000 --outFilterMultimapNmax 50".,Gene expression values were computed with the function featureCounts from the R package Rsubread (v1.22.3). The options for featureCounts were: - min mapping quality 10 - min feature overlap 10bp - count multi-mapping reads - count only primary alignments - count reads also if they overlap multiple genes.,To detect differentially expressed genes we applied a count based negative binomial model implemented in the software package EdgeR (R version: 3.3.2, EdgeR version: 3.14.0 ) [EdgeR]. The differential expression was assessed using an exact test adapted for over-dispersed data. Genes showing altered expression with adjusted (Benjamini and Hochberg method) p-value < 0.05 were considered differentially expressed.,Genome_build: GRCm38.p5,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited txt-file including Raw Gene Counts from FeatureCount Function of Rsubreads
extract_protocol_ch1: Immediately after dissection of peripheral nerves, the perineurium with overlaying epineurium was removed as much as possible, and then the tissues were snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen. Soleus muscle were snap frozen in liquid nitrogen immediately after extraction. Each tissue was mechanically grinded while frozen using an RNAse free pestle to produce smaller chunks and frozen tissue powder. RNA extraction was performed using Qiazol (Qiagen) as per manufacturer's instructions.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using Illumina's TruSeq Stranded Total RNA
title: Soleus muscle from Dnm2 +/K562E mouse 1

characteristics_ch1: strain: B6129SF1,tissue: AGM,age: Embryonic day 10.5,cell type: major arteries PreHSC
data_processing: Sequencing reads were aligned to the mouse genome ( mm9 ) using Tophat. Only uniquely mapped reads with fewer than 2 mismatches were used for downstream analyses.,The Ensembl database (release 66 ) was used as the source of gene annotation. FPKM values were calculated by cufflinks. The featureCounts function of the Subread package was used to extract both gene-level and transcript-level read counts. Differential expression analysis was performed using the edgeR algorithm at gene-level and Ebseq at transcript-level.,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: FPKMs
extract_protocol_ch1: 5 stages of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells were sorted from mouse embryos or adult bone marrow. Total RNA samples were isolated using Rneazy Micro Kit (Qiagen).,Libraries were constructed using NEBNext Ultra RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina according to manufacturer's instructions including the optional double size selection procedure using Agencourt AMPure XP beads. Prepared libraries were quantified with dsDNA HS Kit for Qubit and the size distribution was assessed using High Sensitivity DNA Kit for Bioanalyzer. Libraries were sequenced on Illumina HiSeq2500 in paired-end mode with the read length of 100 nt.
title: PreHSC_RNA-Seq_Rep2

extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was harvested using an RNeasy Micro Kit (Qiagen), using QIAcube according to manufacturer instruction. RNA concentration and RNA integrity were determined by Bioanalyzer (Agilent) using the RNA 6000 Pico chip. High quality RNA samples with RNA Integrity Number â¥ 8 were used as input for RNA-sequencing.,SMART-Seq v4 was used for cDNA synthesis. Sequencing libraries were then made using Illumina's Nextera XT Library Prep kit.

characteristics_ch1: strain: C57BL/6,age: 4 weeks old,genotype/variation: SXR knockout,exposure: DMSO,tissue: liver tissue
data_processing: raw sequencing files were checked for sequence quality using FastQC then aligned to the mm10 genome using the STAR 2.6.0 aligner,unsorted BAM files were checked for mapping quality using FastQC. Reads were counted using Rsubread 3.8/featureCounts (R, Bioconductor) using the parameters TF.featureType = "exon GTF.attrType = "gene_name", allowMultiOverlap = TRUE, isPairedEnd = FALSE, nthreads = 24, countMultiMappingReads = TRUE, StrandSpecific = 0),Differentially expressed genes (DEGs) and normalized counts were obtained using DESeq2 3.8 for each comparision using the parameters: alpha= 0.05,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt files containing DEGs (between the indicated samples in the file name), mean values per group, fold changes, and p-values; txt file containing normalized counts from liver dataset (output of DESeq2)
extract_protocol_ch1: tissues were removed, flash frozen in liquid nitrogen, and RNA was harvested using Trizol reagent. Illumina TruSeq RNA Sample Prep Kit (Cat#FC-122-1001) was used with 1 ug of total RNA for the construction of sequencing libraries.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols

data_processing: bcl2fastq/2.15.0.4,Sequences with RMT of low quality (defined as RMT with minimum Phred score of less than 27) were filtered out.,Pool-barcode and well-barcode-RMT were extracted from the first and second end of the read (respectively) and concatenated to the fastq header, delimited by a underscore i.e. POOL_BARCODE_WELL_BARCODE_RMT while "NNNNNN" was used as a place holders if plate barcode was not used.,Reads were separated by POOL_BARCODE_WELL_BARCODE header data, allowing 1 sequencing error. This process created a single fastq file for each source well.,paired-end (read2 used to read cell and molecule barcodes only),Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include mRNA molecule count values for each Sample,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Meta data file associating each single cell with its amplification batch and index sorting readouts
extract_protocol_ch1: Murine thymi were treated with enzymes cocktail (Collagenase, Dispase and Dnase) at 37C. Cells were separated by Percoll gradient density centrifugation, filtered and stained with Flow cytometry antibodies.,Murin small intestines were flushed with PBS, treated with EDTA, Dispase and Dnase, filtered and stained with Flow cytometry antibodies.,3' end mRNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using MARS-seq (Jaitin et al, Science 2014)
title: AB7224

characteristics_ch1: strain: C57BL/6,organ: Lymph node,selection marker: CD11c+MHCII+lin-,genotype: Ifnar KO,infection: LCMV,infection duration: 48 hours,age: 9 weeks
data_processing: bcl2fastq/2.15.0.4,Sequences with RMT of low quality (defined as RMT with minimum Phred score of less than 27) were filtered out.,Pool-barcode and well-barcode-RMT were extracted from the first and second end of the read (respectively) and concatenated to the fastq header, delimited by a underscore i.e. POOL_BARCODE_WELL_BARCODE_RMT while "NNNNNN" was used as a place holders if plate barcode was not used.,Reads were separated by POOL_BARCODE_WELL_BARCODE header data, allowing 1 sequencing error. This process created a single fastq file for each source well.,paired-end (read2 used to read cell and molecule barcodes only),Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include mRNA molecule count values for each Sample,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Meta data file associating each single cell with its amplification batch and index sorting readouts
extract_protocol_ch1: Murine thymi were treated with enzymes cocktail (Collagenase, Dispase and Dnase) at 37C. Cells were separated by Percoll gradient density centrifugation, filtered and stained with Flow cytometry antibodies.,Murin small intestines were flushed with PBS, treated with EDTA, Dispase and Dnase, filtered and stained with Flow cytometry antibodies.,3' end mRNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using MARS-seq (Jaitin et al, Science 2014)
title: AB7225

characteristics_ch1: strain background: C57BL/6,tissue: Primary chondrocytes,genotype/variation: A2AR KO
contact_address: 435 East 30th St, 9th Floor  New York, NY 10016
data_processing: Alignment with Star,Quantification with HT-seq,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include FPKM values for each Sample
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted from pooled chondrocytes harvested from entire litters of either WT of A2ARKO animals. RNA was extracted from trypsinized primary cells using QUIAGENâs RNeasy Mini Kit (cat. No. 74104) according to manufacturerâs instructions. Three (3) litters of WT and A2ARKO were processed and submitted for RNA sequencing, namely WT1-3 and A2ARKO1-3. Isolated RNA was submitted to and processed by the Genome Technology Center (GTC) at NYU Langone Health using Illumina HiSeq 4000 to acquire chondrocytes transcriptome.
source_name_ch1: Phenotype confirmed global A2AR KO on C57BL/6 background
title: A2ARKO1

characteristics_ch1: strain background: C57Bl6,mouse group: Ht1080 tumor model,treatment: IgG1 antibody treatment,tissue: Brown Adipose Tissue
data_processing: For brown adipose QuantSeq data, the unique molecular identifiers (UMI) were trimmed from the start of the reads using umi2index tools (Lexogen).,Both brown adipose (QuantSeq), white adipose (bulk RNA-seq), and gastrocnemius muscle  (bulk RNA-seq) data raw reads were filtered using Trim Galore! to remove low quality and adaptor bases. Reads shorter than 20nt were discarded.,Filtered reads were mapped to UCSC mm9 genome sequences using STAR (v2.6.0a). The mapped reads of QuantSeq data were collapsed to UMI reads using collapse_UMI_bam tool (Lexogen).,At last, counts of all samples were generated using featureCounts (v1.6.2), and edgeR (v3.22.3) was used to get normalized counts and perform differential gene expression analysis.,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Gene expression raw read counts in tabular data format (txt)
extract_protocol_ch1: Gastrocnemius muscle (GN), white and brown adipose were flash frozen prior to RNA isolation.Â Â RNA was prepared using the Qiagen RNAeasy kit with on column DNAse treatment.Â ,Brown adipose RNA was prepared for sequencing using the UMI second strand synthesis module for QuantSeq 3â mRNA-Seq Library Prep Kit FWD for Illumina (Lexogen) and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq 6000 (100bp single-end reads and 5-10 million reads were generated for each sample). White adipose and gastrocnemius muscle RNA were prepared for sequencing using the TailorMix Directional RNA Sample Preparation Kit (SeqMatic) and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq 6000 (100bp single-end reads and 30-50 million reads were generated for each sample).
title: BAT_IgG1_1 [bat7_S25_L007]

data_processing: For brown adipose QuantSeq data, the unique molecular identifiers (UMI) were trimmed from the start of the reads using umi2index tools (Lexogen).,Both brown adipose (QuantSeq), white adipose (bulk RNA-seq), and gastrocnemius muscle  (bulk RNA-seq) data raw reads were filtered using Trim Galore! to remove low quality and adaptor bases. Reads shorter than 20nt were discarded.,Filtered reads were mapped to UCSC mm9 genome sequences using STAR (v2.6.0a). The mapped reads of QuantSeq data were collapsed to UMI reads using collapse_UMI_bam tool (Lexogen).,At last, counts of all samples were generated using featureCounts (v1.6.2), and edgeR (v3.22.3) was used to get normalized counts and perform differential gene expression analysis.,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Gene expression raw read counts in tabular data format (txt)
extract_protocol_ch1: Gastrocnemius muscle (GN), white and brown adipose were flash frozen prior to RNA isolation.Â Â RNA was prepared using the Qiagen RNAeasy kit with on column DNAse treatment.Â ,Brown adipose RNA was prepared for sequencing using the UMI second strand synthesis module for QuantSeq 3â mRNA-Seq Library Prep Kit FWD for Illumina (Lexogen) and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq 6000 (100bp single-end reads and 5-10 million reads were generated for each sample). White adipose and gastrocnemius muscle RNA were prepared for sequencing using the TailorMix Directional RNA Sample Preparation Kit (SeqMatic) and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq 6000 (100bp single-end reads and 30-50 million reads were generated for each sample).

characteristics_ch1: strain background: C57Bl6,mouse group: Ht1080 tumor model,treatment: 3P10 antibody treatment,tissue: Gastrocnemius Muscle
data_processing: For brown adipose QuantSeq data, the unique molecular identifiers (UMI) were trimmed from the start of the reads using umi2index tools (Lexogen).,Both brown adipose (QuantSeq), white adipose (bulk RNA-seq), and gastrocnemius muscle  (bulk RNA-seq) data raw reads were filtered using Trim Galore! to remove low quality and adaptor bases. Reads shorter than 20nt were discarded.,Filtered reads were mapped to UCSC mm9 genome sequences using STAR (v2.6.0a). The mapped reads of QuantSeq data were collapsed to UMI reads using collapse_UMI_bam tool (Lexogen).,At last, counts of all samples were generated using featureCounts (v1.6.2), and edgeR (v3.22.3) was used to get normalized counts and perform differential gene expression analysis.,Genome_build: mm9,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Gene expression raw read counts in tabular data format (txt)
extract_protocol_ch1: Gastrocnemius muscle (GN), white and brown adipose were flash frozen prior to RNA isolation.Â Â RNA was prepared using the Qiagen RNAeasy kit with on column DNAse treatment.Â ,Brown adipose RNA was prepared for sequencing using the UMI second strand synthesis module for QuantSeq 3â mRNA-Seq Library Prep Kit FWD for Illumina (Lexogen) and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq 6000 (100bp single-end reads and 5-10 million reads were generated for each sample). White adipose and gastrocnemius muscle RNA were prepared for sequencing using the TailorMix Directional RNA Sample Preparation Kit (SeqMatic) and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq 6000 (100bp single-end reads and 30-50 million reads were generated for each sample).

characteristics_ch1: strain: C57Bl/6,tissue: S2/S3 kidney proximal tubules segments
data_processing: Raw sequencing reads in BCL format were processed through bcl2fastq 2.19 (Illumina) for FASTQ conversion and demultiplexing.,Raw RNA-seq data wasÂ quantified to gene-level counts using Kallisto (Bray et al., 2016) withÂ the ARCHS4 pipeline (Lachmann et al., 2017),Raw counts were normalized to log10-Counts Per Million (logCPM) by dividing each column by the total sum of its countsÂ followed by the application of a log10-transform.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab delimited text file containing logCPM values for all samples
extract_protocol_ch1: Mice were perfused with PBS, kidneys removed and stored in RNAlater. Mouse kidneys were sliced and tubule microdissection was performed in ice-cold dissection solution (135 mM NaCl, 1 mM Na2HPO4, 1.2 mM Na2SO4, 1.2 mM MgSO4, 5 mM KCl, 2 mM CaCl2, 5.5 mM glucose, 5 mM HEPES, 0.1% BSA; pH 7.4) using a Leica MZ12.5 stereomicroscope equipped with Leica MC170 HD microscope camera and ThermaZone cooling device. Five to ten S2/S3 PT tubules were pooled together from each kidney and washed with PBS in a separate petri dish. RNA was extracted using PicoPure RNA kit (Applied Biosystems).,cDNA was prepared using TruSeq Stranded mRNA Sample Preparation kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA), according to the manufacturerâs instructions.

characteristics_ch1: strain: NOD,tissue: mTEChi,age: 4-7 weeks,genotype: Aire +/-
data_processing: Data was processed using UTAP pipeline (Kohen et al., 2019). Bcl files were converted into fastq by bcl2fastq. Demultiplexing is done using the sample barcode found on R2, the UMI found on R2 is inserted in the read name (in R1 fastq).  R1 Fastq data submitted.,Reads were trimmed using Cutadapt (parameters: -a AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC -a âA{10}â âtimes 2 -u 3 -u -3 -q 20 -m 25) and mapped to the Mus_musculus genome using STAR v2.4.2a (parameters: âalignEndsType EndToEnd, âoutFilterMismatchNoverLmax 0.05, âtwopassMode Basic, âalignSoftClipAtReferenceEnds No).,The pipeline quantifies the 3â of Gencode annotated genes (The 3â region contains 1,000 bases upstream of the 3â end and 100 bases downstream). Counting proceeded over genes annotated in RefSeq release using htseq-count (union mode). Genes having minimum 5 UMI-corrected reads in at least one sample, were considered. Normalization of the counts and differential expression analysis was performed using DESeq2 package.,Differential expression analysis was performed using DESeq2 with the betaPrior set to False. Raw P values were adjusted for multiple testing using the procedure of Benjamini and Hochberg. Differentially expressed genes were defined as genes that had a significant adjusted p value of less than 0.05 and at least 2-fold change.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw counts, normalized abundance measurements and DESeq2 analysis
extract_protocol_ch1: Thymi were removed and enzymatically dissociated with Liberase TH and DNase. mTEChi were sorted and RNA was extracted using Dynabeads. MARSseq protocol was used construction of sequencing libraries.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using the MARSseq protocol (Jaitin et. Al. 2014),Bulk Mars-Seq (3' end-RNA-seq)
title: 392aireh

R1 Fastq data submitted.,Reads were trimmed using Cutadapt (parameters: -a AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC -a âA{10}â âtimes 2 -u 3 -u -3 -q 20 -m 25) and mapped to the Mus_musculus genome using STAR v2.4.2a (parameters: âalignEndsType EndToEnd, âoutFilterMismatchNoverLmax 0.05, âtwopassMode Basic, âalignSoftClipAtReferenceEnds No).,The pipeline quantifies the 3â of Gencode annotated genes (The 3â region contains 1,000 bases upstream of the 3â end and 100 bases downstream). Counting proceeded over genes annotated in RefSeq release using htseq-count (union mode). Genes having minimum 5 UMI-corrected reads in at least one sample, were considered. Normalization of the counts and differential expression analysis was performed using DESeq2 package.,Differential expression analysis was performed using DESeq2 with the betaPrior set to False. Raw P values were adjusted for multiple testing using the procedure of Benjamini and Hochberg. Differentially expressed genes were defined as genes that had a significant adjusted p value of less than 0.05 and at least 2-fold change.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Raw counts, normalized abundance measurements and DESeq2 analysis
extract_protocol_ch1: Thymi were removed and enzymatically dissociated with Liberase TH and DNase. mTEChi were sorted and RNA was extracted using Dynabeads. MARSseq protocol was used construction of sequencing libraries.,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using the MARSseq protocol (Jaitin et. Al. 2014),Bulk Mars-Seq (3' end-RNA-seq)
title: Aire_het_435

characteristics_ch1: strain: C57BL/6,tissue: Sciatic Nerve,age: D14 after CCI,genotype: Macblue x Cx3cr1egfp/+,treatment: CCI
data_processing: Quality of raw data has been evaluated with FastQC. Poor quality sequences have been trimmed or removed with Trimmomatic software to retain only good quality paired reads.,Star v2.5.3a has been used to align reads on mm10 reference genome using standard options. Quantification of gene and isoform abundances has been done with rsem 1.2.28, prior to normalization on library size with DESEq2 bioconductor package.,Finally, differential analysis has been conducted with edgeR bioconductor package. Multiple hypothesis adjusted p-values were calculated with the Benjamini-Hochberg procedure to control FDR.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Matrix table with raw gene counts for every gene and every sample,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Matrix table with fpkm values for every gene and every sample
extract_protocol_ch1: Sorted cells were lysed in 100Âµl of RA1/TCEP buffer (NucleoSpin RNA XS, Macherey-Nagel), snap frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at -80C until RNA extraction. Input cell numbers were adjusted to be the same for all samples, around 400 cells. All samples were processed in parallel and RNA extraction (without Carrier RNA but with on-column DNase treatment) was performed according to manufacturer's instructions (NucleoSpin RNA XS, Macherey-Nagel). RNA was eluted in RNAse-free water.,Preparation of cDNA libraries for RNAseq was done using the SmartSeq method according to manufacturer's instructions (SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA Kit for Sequencing, Clontech/TaKaRa). Due to the low number of cells, the total amount of eluted RNA was used as starting material for reverse transcription, followed by 18 cycles of pre-amplification. 1ng of cDNA were used for RNAseq sequencing library preparation, according to manufacturer's instructions (Nextera XT DNA Library Preparation, Illumina). Final samples pooled library prep were sequenced on a Nextseq 500 ILLUMINA with MidOutPut cartridge (2x130Millions of 75 bases reads) with 2 runs (4plex and 5plex), corresponding to 2x30Millions of (paired-end) reads per sample after demultiplexing.
title: EGFP+ macrophages sorted from ipsi lateral nerves representing resident macrophages in injured nerves, rep2

characteristics_ch1: age: P0,genotype: Ifnar -/-,cell type: Hematopoietic progenitor cell
data_processing: The resulting sequencing reads were demultiplexed by index with a custom Python demultiplexing script and further demultiplexed by barcode with a custom Perl demultiplexing script.,The RNA-Seq reads were then aligned to the Mus musculus Ensembl release 76 top-level assembly with STAR version 3.0.4.b.,Gene counts were derived from the number of uniquely aligned unambiguous reads by Subread:featureCount version 1.4.5.,Sailfish version 0.6.3. was used to produce isoform estimated counts.,Genome_build: Ensemble R76,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include read count values for each Sample
extract_protocol_ch1: Qiagen RNAeasy micro plus,Clontech SMRTr
title: P0 Ifnar ko HPC-1 [s4545_3018_1_N]

data_processing: Adaptor triming: Trim Galore! (0.4.1),Alignment: STAR (2.5.3),Differential Expression Analysis: DESeq2 (1.22.2),Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was harvested using an RNeasy Micro Kit (Qiagen), using QIAcube according to manufacturer instruction. RNA concentration and RNA integrity were determined by Bioanalyzer (Agilent) using the RNA 6000 Pico chip. High quality RNA samples with RNA Integrity Number â¥ 8 were used as input for RNA-sequencing.,SMART-Seq v4 was used for cDNA synthesis. Sequencing libraries were then made using Illumina's Nextera XT Library Prep kit.

characteristics_ch1: organ: Aorta,genotype: EGFR KO,treatment: SD
data_processing: Alignment (HISAT2 2.1.0),Counting (featureCounts - 2.0.0),Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: txt files containing raw counts obtained after Counting with featureCounts
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated with TriZol Reagent, following the manufacturer's instructions. Eventual gDNA contaminations were removed using Turbo DNAse (ambion, Life Technologies).,mRNA were enriched using oligo(dT) beads and then fragmented randomly by adding fragmentation buffer. cDNA synthesis is done with random hexamers primers and is followed by second strand synthesis after sequencing adaptor ligation. Double-stranded cDNA libraries are then subjected to size selection (250-300bp) and PCR enrichment. Libraries were pooled before clustering on flowcell for sequencing.
source_name_ch1: Aorta from mouse with endothelial cells-EGFR KO

Double-stranded cDNA libraries are then subjected to size selection (250-300bp) and PCR enrichment. Libraries were pooled before clustering on flowcell for sequencing.

characteristics_ch1: cell type: embryonic stem cell,culture condition: 2i
data_processing: Basecalling and bcl to fastq generation was done using bcl2fastq2 v2.18 from illumina.,RNA-seq was aligned to genome mm10 from UCSC using STAR aligner,TPM expression was generated using RSEM,ChIP-seq was aligned to genome mm10 using bowtie2,Bigwig files are normalized and extended to fragment length for IP samples,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: RNA-seq TPM in excel file, ChIP-seq in bigwig files
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated by first homogenizing cells in 1ml TRIzol reagent (Invitrogen 15596026) through triturating the cell lysate through a 27-gauge needle a minimum of 7 times. Homogenized samples were mixed with 200Âµ l chloroform and vigorously shaken by hand for 30sec. Samples were then incubated at RT for 10min before centrifuging at 12,000g for 10min at RT. The aqueous phase containing RNA was transferred to a new tube, mixed with 100Âµ l chloroform, and subjected to a second round of shaking, incubation and centrifuging.  The aqueous phase was transferred to a new tube containing 1.5Âµ l 20mg/ml glycogen, and mixed with 450Âµ l isopropanol to pre- cipitate RNA. Samples were gently mixed and incubated at RT for 10min before centrifuging at 4 Â°C for 15min. The supernatant was discarded and the pellet was washed by 1ml 75% ethanol. After the wash the RNA pellet was dried at RT for 20min and resuspended in RNase-free water. Yield and purity of RNA was determined by spectrophotometry with Nano drop (Thermo Scien- tific). The RNA was treated with DNase (Promega M6101),RNA-seq and ChIP-seq libraries were prepared using the TruSeq RNA kit for sequencing,
title: V6.5_ES_2i_rep1

characteristics_ch1: strain: mSOD1,organ: meninges,cell type: B and T cells,selection marker: CD45+TCRB+B220+,infection: NA,time point: day136,mouse age: day136
data_processing: bcl2fastq/2.15.0.4,read 1 contains the biological sequence,read2 used to read cell and molecule barcodes only. The first 7N is the cell barcode the next  8N is the UMI for the read.,Sequences with RMT of low quality (defined as RMT with minimum Phred score of less than 27) were filtered out.,Pool-barcode and well-barcode-RMT were extracted from the first and second end of the read (respectively) and concatenated to the fastq header, delimited by a underscore i.e. POOL_BARCODE_WELL_BARCODE_RMT while "NNNNNN" was used as a place holders if plate barcode was not used.,Reads were separated by POOL_BARCODE_WELL_BARCODE header data, allowing 1 sequencing error. This process created a single fastq file for each source well.,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-delimited text files include mRNA molecule count values for each Sample
extract_protocol_ch1: Mice were euthanized and spinal cord meninges and cervical LNs were disected. cLN were digested in IMDM (Sigma-Aldrich) media supplemented with Liberase-TL (100Î¼g/ml, Roche) and DNase-I (100Î¼g/ml, Roche), and spinal cord meninges were digested in RPMI (Sigma-Aldrich) media supplemented with collagenase IV (40U/ml, Roche) and DNase-I (100Î¼g/ml, Roche). Both tissues were incubated with frequent agitation at 37oC for 20 min. After the dissociation procedures, cells were washed with sorting buffer, filtered through 100Î¼m, 70Î¼m and 40Î¼m cell strainers, and centrifuged at 380g, 5min, 4oC.,Single-cell RNA-seq libraries were prepared as previously described {Jaitin, 2014}. In brief, mRNA from single cells sorted into capture plates were barcoded and converted into cDNA and then pooled using an automated pipeline. The pooled sample was linearly amplified by T7 in vitro transcription, and the resulting RNA was fragmented and converted into a sequencing-ready library by tagging the samples with pool barcodes and Illumina sequences during ligation, RT, and PCR. Each pool of cells was tested for library quality and concentration as described previously {Jaitin, 2014}
title: AB7301

data_processing: Illumina CASAVA 1.8 software used for basecalling.,Qualified reads were obtained after removing raw reads with adapters or of low quality and then aligned to the mouse genome by HISAT with default parameters.,RSeQC was used to measured gene expression abundance as reads per kilobase per million mapped reads (RPKM).,Differential expression analysis of two samples was performed using the previous statistics model. data_processing: Illumina CASAVA 1.8 software used for basecalling.,Qualified reads were obtained after removing raw reads with adapters or of low quality and then aligned to the mouse genome by HISAT with default parameters.,RSeQC was used to measured gene expression abundance as reads per kilobase per million mapped reads (RPKM).,Differential expression analysis of two samples was performed using the previous statistics model. The resulting P-values were adjusted using the Benjamini and Hochberg's approach for controlling the false discovery rate. P-value <0.05 were assigned as differentially expressed gene.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted with Trizol reagent,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols.

data_processing: Illumina CASAVA 1.8 software used for basecalling.,Qualified reads were obtained after removing raw reads with adapters or of low quality and then aligned to the mouse genome by HISAT with default parameters.,RSeQC was used to measured gene expression abundance as reads per kilobase per million mapped reads (RPKM).,Differential expression analysis of two samples was performed using the previous statistics model. The resulting P-values were adjusted using the Benjamini and Hochberg's approach for controlling the false discovery rate. P-value <0.05 were assigned as differentially expressed gene.

title: S5-8

characteristics_ch1: strain: B6.129S7-Ldlrtm1Her/J,treatment: --,diet: Standard Chow
data_processing: For RNA seq; RNA-seq reads were processed using the Tuxedo V2 protocol410. Briefly, reads were trimmed of adapter sequences associated with the Library Prep Kit using TrimGalore!, v0.5.0.  Trimmed reads were aligned to the mm10 genome using HISAT2 (v2.0.5) and transcript counts were determined using Stringtie (v2.0.4).,For single cell RNAseq; Digital gene expression matrices were generated with the Cell Ranger Pipeline v3.1 and aligned to the mm10-2020-A reference transcriptome. The resulting digital gene expression matrix was filtered, normalized, and clustered using R 4.0.2 and Seurat 3.2.145,46, as per MacParland et al.47. Briefly, features that were detected in less than 3 cells and cells with less than 200 features were excluded.   We further filtered out cells with greater than 5000 transcripts or a mitochondrial transcriptome of >25%.  Normalization was performed using LogNormalize feature with a scale factor of 100000.  PCA was performed on the top 2000 variable features that were identified using the âvstâ selection method. This resulted in 4298 and 5396 cells for the non-BMT and BMT datasets, respectively.  The non-BMT and BMT datasets were integrated using the Harmony algorithm48 based on the first 15 principal components.  Cells were clustered using the Louvain algorithm based on the first 20 harmony dimensions with a resolution of 0.25. UMAP was used for non-linear reduction and two-dimensional data visualization.,Genome_build: mm10 (RNAseq) and mm10-2020A (scRNAseq)
extract_protocol_ch1: For RNA sequencing the RNeasy micro kit (Cat. No. 74004, Qiagen) as per manufacturers protocol. For single cell sequencing the 10x Genomics Single Cell 3â² v2/v3 Reagent Kit user guide for the non-BMT (Ldlr-/-) and BMT (WT to Ldlr-/-) sample respectively.,For RNA sequencing the NEBNextÂ® Single Cell/Low Input RNA Library Prep Kit for IlluminaÂ®, using the manufacturerâs direct RNA input protocol (NEB). For single cell sequencing the v2 Chromiumâ¢ Single Cell 3Ê¹ Library Kit and the v3 Chromiumâ¢ Single Cell 3Ê¹ Library Kit was used for the non-BMT (Ldlr-/-) and BMT (WT to Ldlr-/-) sample respectively.
title: Ldlr KO 1 RNA-seq

Trimmed reads were aligned to the mm10 genome using HISAT2 (v2.0.5) and transcript counts were determined using Stringtie (v2.0.4).,For single cell RNAseq; Digital gene expression matrices were generated with the Cell Ranger Pipeline v3.1 and aligned to the mm10-2020-A reference transcriptome. The resulting digital gene expression matrix was filtered, normalized, and clustered using R 4.0.2 and Seurat 3.2.145,46, as per MacParland et al.47. Briefly, features that were detected in less than 3 cells and cells with less than 200 features were excluded.   We further filtered out cells with greater than 5000 transcripts or a mitochondrial transcriptome of >25%.  Normalization was performed using LogNormalize feature with a scale factor of 100000.  PCA was performed on the top 2000 variable features that were identified using the âvstâ selection method. This resulted in 4298 and 5396 cells for the non-BMT and BMT datasets, respectively.  The non-BMT and BMT datasets were integrated using the Harmony algorithm48 based on the first 15 principal components.  Cells were clustered using the Louvain algorithm based on the first 20 harmony dimensions with a resolution of 0.25. UMAP was used for non-linear reduction and two-dimensional data visualization.,Genome_build: mm10 (RNAseq) and mm10-2020A (scRNAseq)
extract_protocol_ch1: For RNA sequencing the RNeasy micro kit (Cat. No. 74004, Qiagen) as per manufacturers protocol. For single cell sequencing the 10x Genomics Single Cell 3â² v2/v3 Reagent Kit user guide for the non-BMT (Ldlr-/-) and BMT (WT to Ldlr-/-) sample respectively.,For RNA sequencing the NEBNextÂ® Single Cell/Low Input RNA Library Prep Kit for IlluminaÂ®, using the manufacturerâs direct RNA input protocol (NEB). For single cell sequencing the v2 Chromiumâ¢ Single Cell 3Ê¹ Library Kit and the v3 Chromiumâ¢ Single Cell 3Ê¹ Library Kit was used for the non-BMT (Ldlr-/-) and BMT (WT to Ldlr-/-) sample respectively.
title: Ldlr KO + BMT and 5dCRD 1 RNA-seq

characteristics_ch1: genotype: LAIR1-/-,tissue: Bone marrow,cell type: Nonclassical monocytes,library construction: HiSeq Rapid SBS Kit v2
data_processing: RNA-sequencing data were analyzed using HTSeqGenie (Wu et al., 2016)(Pau and Reeder, 2012) as follows:,first, reads with low nucleotide qualities (70% of bases with quality <23) or rRNA and adapter contamination were removed.,The reads that passed were then aligned to the mouse reference genome GRCm38.p5 using GSNAP (Wu and Nacu, 2010) version â2013-10-10-v2â with alignment parameters: â-M 2 -n 10 -B 2 -i 1 -N 1 -w 200000 -E 1 --pairmax-rna=200000'.,Alignments of the reads that were reported by GSNAP as âuniquely mappingâ were used for subsequent analysis.,Gene expression levels were quantified as Reads Per Kilobase of exon model per Million mapped reads normalized by size factor (nRPKM), defined as number of reads aligning to a gene in a sample / (total number of uniquely mapped reads for that sample x gene length x size factor).,Genome_build: GRCm38.p5,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Matrix table with raw gene counts for every gene and every sample
extract_protocol_ch1: Non-classical monocytes were sorted (purity 98%) from the bone marrow of LAIR1â/â and LAIR1+/+. 5000-10000 cells were collected and RNA was extracted using Nucleospin RNA XS (Takara) and low input RNA sequencing was performed (Clontech).,RNA libraries were prepared for sequencing using standard Illumina protocols
title: Nonclassical monocytes LAIRKO1 [SAM24362397]

characteristics_ch1: genotype: NCAM-1 KO
contact_institute: New York University, NYU Langone Medical Center
data_processing: Basecalls performed using CASAVA,RNA-Seq reads were mapped to mm10 using STAR guided by GTF,Calculating insert size and standard deviation performed using Picard tools,RNA-Seq read counting performed using HT-seq,Normalization and Deferential expression analyses performed using DEseq2,BAM to bedgraph performed using bedtools,bedgraph to bigwig performed using bedGraphToBigWig v4,Statistics and plotting performed in R v3.3.0,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Count Tables (.txt)  BigWig files (.bw)
extract_protocol_ch1: PicoPure RNA Isolation Kit,RNA from adult mouse hearts was extracted from cells captured onto thermoplastic film using the PicoPure RNA Isolation Kit (Arcturus Engineering, Mountain View, CA). RNA from NRVMs was extracted using silica-membrane spin columns from the RNeasy Plus Mini Kit (Qiagen, Netherlands). For RNA-seq, RNA from sorted Purkinje cells and Ventricular Myocytes cells, was amplified and libraries prepared using the Automated Nugen Ovation Trio Low input RNA (Nugen). RNAseq experiments were done at the NYU School of Medicine Genome Technology center. Samples from were sequenced 50 bp paired-ended at 10 million to 20 million reads per replicate on an Illumina HiSeq2500 instrument. All the reads were mapped to the mouse reference genome (mm10) using the STAR aligner (v2.5.0c). Alignments were guided by a Gene Transfer File (GTF, version GRCm38.74) and the mean read insert sizes and their standard deviations were calculated using Picard tools (v.1.126) (http://broadinstitute.github.io/picard/). The read count tables were generated using HTSeq (v0.6.0) and normalized based on their library size factors using DESeq2 (v3.0) and differential expression analysis was performed. The Read Per Million (RPM) normalized BigWig files were generated using BEDTools (v2.17.0) and bedGraphToBigWig tool (v4), and downstream statistical analyses and generating plots were performed in R environment (v3.1.1) (http://www.r-project.org/).
title: NCAM-1 KO PC3

data_processing: Sequenced reads were trimmed for adaptor sequence using Cutadapt and then mapped to mm10 whole genome using STAR_2.5.3a with parameters --chimSegmentMin 15 --chimJunctionOverhangMin 15 --outSAMstrandField intronMotif --runThreadN 12 --twopassMode Basic --outFilterType BySJout --outFilterMultimapNmax 20 --alignSJoverhangMin 8 --alignSJDBoverhangMin 1 --sjdbScore 1 --outFilterMismatchNmax 999 --alignIntronMin 20 --alignIntronMax 1000000 --alignMatesGapMax 1000000 --outFilterMismatchNoverReadLmax 0.04 --outStd SAM --outSAMmode Full --outSAMattributes NH HI AS NM MD --outSAMtype BAM SortedByCoordinate --outSAMunmapped Within âquantMode TranscriptomeSAM GeneCounts --outWigType bedGraph --outWigNorm RPM --outWigStrand Unstranded --outFileNamePrefix  Raw counts per gene model (GENCODE M22) were extracted with featureCounts v1.6.4,Genome_build: mm10,Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab delimited featurecounts output file with the following columns: GENCODE M22 gene ID, Chr, Start, End, Strand, Length, total_read_count
extract_protocol_ch1: Laser-capture microdissection, followed by RNA extraction using the Arcturus Picopure RNA Isolation Kit with on-column DNase digestion as described by the manufacturer,Following RNA extraction, cDNA synthesis was performed using Ovation RNA-Seq System V2 amplification. Libraries were then prepared using the Nextera XT tagmentation protocol.
